page.title: 17Southam Fire Brigade
page.content: Southam Fire Brigade was established in 1812 and is still in service today based on the Coventry Road. A family tradition which dates back a hundred years is currently being upheld. Members of the Burnell family have been serving firemen since 1883 with only one break in the tradition in 1969. With younger members of the family eager to carry on, the tradition seems set to last. The fire station is manned by mainly part-time firemen who carry a bleeper with them as they go about their normal work. The bleeper warns them of any emergency calls. Calls are relayed by teleprinter from Leamington. Each fireman must attend courses and training sessions on Thursday evening. The biggest worry facing the firemen today is the number of road accidents involving dangerous chemicals.
